title: Apple Wins Delay in Monopoly Case, Allowing App Store Rules to Stay For Now
sub_head: Ruling puts off enforcement in case between iPhone maker, Epic Games until appeal can be heard
body:
Apple Inc. on Wednesday won a U.S. appeals court reprieve in rolling out changes to the App Store ordered by a federal judge as part of the big tech company’s antitrust battle with Epic Games Inc.
The Ninth U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals granted the iPhone maker’s request to delay implementation of a federal judge’s order to force Apple to allow developers to communicate with users inside their apps about alternative payment methods outside of the App Store.
